meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices isolationism.
meanings.sent1: The isolationist preferred to keep to themselves and avoid interactions with others.
meanings.sent2: The country's leader was known to be an isolationist, focusing on internal affairs rather than international relations.
meanings.sent3: The isolationist decided to spend the weekend alone in the woods, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
meanings.sent4: Hermit crabs can be seen as isolationists, always retreating into their shells when they feel threatened.
meanings.sent5: The isolationist's cabin in the mountains was a true sanctuary from the chaos of the world.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of isolationism.
meanings.sent1: The isolationist policy aimed to limit foreign influence on the country's economy.
meanings.sent2: The isolationist approach to diplomacy focused on avoiding alliances with other nations.
meanings.sent3: The isolationist cat refused to socialize with the other pets in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The dark, isolated cave had an isolationist feel, cut off from the rest of the world.
meanings.sent5: The isolationist mindset of the community led to a lack of diversity in their beliefs.
